title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: can install development version RStudioBackupPrefs GitHub :
code: install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs")  # Alternatively install.packages("librarian")  librarian::shelf("Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs")  # librarian::shelf() will install or load the package if already installed. # You can queue up multiple package in one line.

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: idea install package new R project machine, import preferences GitHub first cloning repository containing rstudio preference files copying relevant RStudio preference folder. backing , idea upload current RStudio settings currently git initiated repository, choose dedicated git repository RStudio settings thus another folder local machine.

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: Back using specific folder containing preference files. working directory currently inside R project, ’d want specify path R folder outside current one (else ’s current one)
code: library(RStudioBackupPrefs) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE) start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE, repository = "../MyRStudioPrefs")

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: function pull GitHub default, copy files rstudio preference folder (import). Note specify folder RStudio preference files backed , folder, obtained start_backup_prefs() function. example, start_backup_prefs(preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences") create folder named R/rstudio_preferences/ current working directory.

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from GitHub
what: You have a new R project and want to import your preferences from GitHub
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: required clone repository containing preferences first. convenience can clone GitHub folder copy function. Use clone_git = TRUE, function ask git url list GitHub repositories current git username can specify git url directly. Use list_github_repositories() list repositories current git username. Specify clone path want clone specific folder.
code: start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE) list_github_repositories() start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE, git_url = "https://github.com/cran/dummies") start_import_prefs(clone_git = TRUE, git_path = "../MyRStudioPrefs")

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from GitHub > You already have a Git repository cloned
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
code: start_import_prefs(preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/")

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from GitHub > You already have a Git repository cloned
what: Your files are in a different R Project/Git folder
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: git pull work inside git folder regardless file path.
code: start_import_prefs("../MyRStudioPrefs/R/rstudio_preferences/")

previous_headings: Quick Start > Import preferences from GitHub > You already have a Git repository cloned
what: Your files are already in your current project, specify your path
title: RStudioBackupPrefs
code: start_import_prefs(preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/", pull_github = FALSE)

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: Use start_import_prefs(pull_github = FALSE) import preferences local folder.
code: # Choose a path start_backup_prefs(preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences", copy_to_local = TRUE)   # If you are fine with leaving files in your RStudio preference folder start_backup_prefs()  # Use open_backup_path = TRUE to see the RStudio preference folder start_backup_prefs(open_backup_path = TRUE)

title: RStudioBackupPrefs
text: use GitHub functionalities, need initiated repository. Simply initiate one : Make sure put user.name user.email global config. , go Terminal write: Check Happy Git R information.
code: # Assuming you're in your desired folder path: usethis::use_git() usethis::use_github()  # Optional: usethis::git_vaccinate()  # Set your credentials if needed: gitcreds::gitcreds_set() git init git config --global user.name "YOUR FULL NAME" git config --global user.email "YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS"

title: Authors and Citation
text: Minh-Anh Huynh. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Huynh M (2024). RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily Backup RStudio Preferences Import GitHub. R package version 0.1.0,  https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/, https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs.
code: @Manual{,   title = {RStudioBackupPrefs: Easily Backup your RStudio Preferences and Import Them on from GitHub},   author = {Minh-Anh Huynh},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0,  https://minh-anhhuynh.github.io/RStudioBackupPrefs/},   url = {https://github.com/Minh-AnhHuynh/RStudioBackupPrefs}, }

what: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
text: List online git repositories current user

title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
code: list_github_repositories(username = get_current_git_username)

title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
text: username string. git username list repositories. Default current git username.

title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
text: list current public repositories current git user

title: List the online git repositories of the current user — list_github_repositories
code: list_github_repositories("cran") #> GitHub repositories for user cran : #> -  https://github.com/cran/A3  #> -  https://github.com/cran/AalenJohansen  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aaMI  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aaSEA  #> -  https://github.com/cran/AATtools  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aba  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABACUS  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abasequence  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abbreviate  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abbyyR  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abc  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abc.data  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABC.RAP  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcADM  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCanalysis  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcdeFBA  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCExtremes  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abclass  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCoptim  #> -  https://github.com/cran/ABCp2  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcrf  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abcrlda  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abctools  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abd  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abdiv  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abe  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abemus  #> -  https://github.com/cran/aberrance  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abess  #> -  https://github.com/cran/abf2  if (FALSE) { list_github_repositories() }

what: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: Function start backing files folder .bak. Make sure git initiated repository wish upload GitHub repository.

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
code: start_backup_prefs(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences",   github_backup = FALSE,   copy_to_local = FALSE,   open_backup_path = FALSE,   git_message = "Backup of R Studio preferences on {Sys.Date()}",   repository = "." )

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: preference_path string. Path local backup folder github_backup logical. Upload file github. copy_to_local logical. Copy .json files local TRUE. copy files repository folder specified. open_backup_path logical. Open default backup folder convenience TRUE. git_message string. git commit message. Default "Backup R Studio preferences Sys.Date()." repository string. Defaults current git repository. want upload another repository, specify path.

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: Backup rstudio_bindings.json, addins.json rstudio-bindings.json r.snippets .bak files native rstudioconfig folder. copy files working directory chosen file path executes git push github_backup = TRUE

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
text: Function wrapper using backup_prefs(). github_backup = TRUE, use functions: copy_files_to_local() upload_prefs_to_github()

title: Start the backup process from local to github — start_backup_prefs
code: # Copy files to the selected directory temp_dir <- tempdir() start_backup_prefs(copy_to_local = TRUE, preference_path = temp_dir) #> ✔ Preferences files copied to /tmp/RtmpsyOTkt unlink(temp_dir)  if (FALSE) { # Backup prefs to the current git initiated repository start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE)  # Backup prefs to another local git repository that is not the current one, # matching one in the cloud start_backup_prefs(github_backup = TRUE, repository = "../MyRStudioPrefs") }

what: Start the import process from GitHub or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
title: Start the import process from GitHub or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: Import preferences cloning link pulling GitHub. function start pull currently active GitHub repository, import local .json preference files. function look specific .json files , given file path. cloning chosen, folder inside working directory.

title: Start the import process from GitHub or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
code: start_import_prefs(   preference_path = "R/rstudio_preferences/",   pull_github = TRUE,   clone_git = FALSE,   git_url = NULL,   git_path = NULL )

title: Start the import process from GitHub or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: preference_path string. Input file path preferences json files located. pull_github logical. Use TRUE pull clone GitHub, otherwise FALSE just import local files. clone_git logical. Default FALSE. Clone git first time usage. convenience function avoid manually, essentially gert::git_clone("github_url"). clone repository inside current working directory. git_url string. Allows user bypass request git url directly clone desired git url repository working directory. git_path string. path clone git repository. Default current working directory.

title: Start the import process from GitHub or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: Cloned repository /preference files copied RStudio's preference folder

title: Start the import process from GitHub or your local json preference files — start_import_prefs
text: Function wrapper import_from_github() followed import_local_prefs()
